alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 12:59PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following county, Ashland. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding across the county. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1258 PM EDT, Emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ashland, Loudonville, New London, Hayesville, Savannah, Polk, Sullivan, Perrysville, Jeromesville, Bailey Lakes, Mifflin, Nankin, Rowsburg, Mohicanville and Nova.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
